title: Where The Goddess Dwells
opening: In the pursuit of justice for Jeralt, you and your students find yourselves deep in the Sealed Forest.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: You're here again... Professor... You've been crying. So even you cry sometimes. Oh... I suppose that was thoughtless of me to say.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Yes, it was.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Long ago, someone said the same to me.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: It's fine.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: My teacher. You're so blinded by grief that you can't see what's going on right in front of you.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Are you waiting for time to heal your wounds? Or have you curled up in a corner and lost the will to carry on?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Does it matter?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: It does. You've lost yourself.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: How could you ask me something like that?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: It's not like you to speak to me like that. You know I'd never ask you a question without purpose.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Only you can truly understand your own sadness. Others can sympathize or even empathize, but all anyone else can offer are the tears of an outsider looking in. So I have no intention of crying for you, or of standing still with you. All I can do is promise to reach out my hand when the time comes for me to move forward.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: The mysterious organization that was carrying out experiments in Remire Village and the chapel... They're up to something near Garreg Mach. The archbishop has sent the knights to undertake a large-scale investigation. No information has surfaced yet, but our enemies will soon be discovered. When they are, will you lead us into battle? Or will you just sit here with no thought for the future that is fast approaching? My teacher... There is a choice to be made. I hope you make the right one.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: My, my. She really is quite arrogant. She spoke her mind without an ounce of reservation! But she is right. The time has come to stand again. You already know what your answer is.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Oh, thank you. You saved me!

dialogue.speaker: Thales
dialogue.line: If you were to die, then the mystery of our bodies would be revealed. Preventing that was my only aim. I'm afraid you must remain, Kronya. There is something I need you to do.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Oh, of course. I am always happy to cooperate with Solon. Leave it to me.

dialogue.speaker: Flame Emperor
dialogue.line: How annoying.

dialogue.speaker: Thales
dialogue.line: Flame Emperor... Is she offending you? Unfortunately, we cannot take our eyes off her, so there is nothing to be done. You are our greatest creation. We used the defiled beast's blood as the fuel to your flame, that you may burn even the gods. Now is the time to cleanse Fódlan of that power, and bring forth our salvation.

dialogue.speaker: Flame Emperor
dialogue.line: There will be no salvation for you and your kind. Those responsible for such gruesome deeds in Duscur and Enbarr.

dialogue.speaker: Thales
dialogue.line: All so that you may acquire the strength you need. All for a purpose...

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: What are you going at this hour? Ooh, I know... You are eavesdropping! I must admit that I approve.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Professor? We must remain quiet...

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: I see... The Flame Emperor and Monica...and the mage who rescued Monica.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: It's time for revenge.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Not yet, Professor.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What is that guy's name?

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: I don't know, but if we keep listening, we might be able to find out.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: An unexpected change to hear their plans! Patience, patience!

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Oh, thank you. You saved me!

dialogue.speaker: Thales
dialogue.line: If you were to die, then the mystery of our bodies would be revealed. Preventing that was my only aim. I'm afraid you must remain, Kronya. There is something I need you to do.

dialogue.speaker: Monica
dialogue.line: Oh, of course. I am always happy to cooperate with Solon. Leave it to me.

dialogue.speaker: Flame Emperor
dialogue.line: How annoying.

dialogue.speaker: Thales
dialogue.line: Flame Emperor... Is she offending you? Unfortunately, we cannot take our eyes off her, so there is nothing to be done. You are our greatest creation. We used the defiled beast's blood as the fuel to your flame, that you may burn even the gods. Now is the time to cleanse Fódlan of that power, and bring forth our salvation.

dialogue.speaker: Flame Emperor
dialogue.line: There will be no salvation for you and your kind. Those responsible for such gruesome deeds in Duscur and Enbarr.

dialogue.speaker: Thales
dialogue.line: All so that you may acquire the strength you need. All for a purpose...

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: I've got you... Finally...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Wait.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Don't go out there.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Let's keep listening.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: If we don't act now, we'll miss our chance!

dialogue.speaker: Flame Emperor
dialogue.line: Hmm...

dialogue.speaker: Thales
dialogue.line: Hmph. Even if someone has overhead us, there is nothing they can do. There have always been rats in the walls, and there always will be.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: No... The dagger...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What's wrong?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What about the dagger?

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: It...no. Never mind. It couldn't possibly be so. Professor, those are the ones we must destroy. They're the bastards who killed my family and Jeralt. For now, let's return to the monastery and regroup. As for the Flame Emperor's dagger...I'll hold on to it for the time being.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Day 5 of the Garland Moon. I picked some flowers for her and returned home. The look of joy on her face at the sight of these flowers will be even more beautiful than the flowers themselves… Yeesh! That is enough. His entries from before your birth are full of such romantic blatherings as that. Oh… It must be deeply moving you to hear such things, but now is not the time for whimsy. Someone is here. You do not wish for them to see you in this state. So pull yourself together!

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: I thought I might find you here, Teach. Not the type to wallow in solitude, eh? That's a relief, let me tell you. So… What were you reading? Is that Jeralt's…

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Diary.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: So it is.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Love letter.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: The contents are certainly bittersweet… But I think it's Jeralt's diary.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Hey, maybe this has some entries from when Jeralt left the monastery.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Is that so… He was the captain of the knights, but something made him leave the monastery in a hurry. If it has something to do with your birth, knowing what happened may get us closer to knowing what secrets the church is hiding… Teach… Would you mind letting me read that diary? I know how important it is to you, but I'm not asking lightly. Please, allow me to borrow it.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: You may borrow it.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: I'm forever in your debt, Teach. If you'd refused, I would've had to sneak in here in the dead of night. I wasn't looking forward to that prospect. Anyway, let me fill you in on what's been going on lately, and not just as thanks for pointing me to that diary.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I can't allow it.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Wait, are you really saying I'm going to have to sneak in here in the dead of night to read it? I know how important it is to you, but I'm not asking lightly. Please, allow me to borrow it.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Rhea dispatched the knights to various locations in a frantic search for the enemy. There's a rumor that she's already secured some information. Something big is gonna happen soon. That has me wondering… If you find out where the enemy is, what will you do about it? If you ask, I… No, scratch that. All of us students would gladly lend a hand. Even if it means going against Rhea's wishes. Don't forget it. Now go. Everyone's worried about you. You'd better show them you're in good spirits.

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: If you must weep, then weep. I shall be here for you.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: Well, it would be ridiculous not to feel anything after something like that. Go on and let it out. I am here.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That won't be necessary.

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: Are you already past it? You are unflappable. I will give you that much. In that case, I will remain silently supportive. You are right that we must keep moving ever onward.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Professor, I'm so happy to see you. You're finally returning to your old self. To see the light in your eyes again is a gift. It inspires me to carry on as well. As you know, the knights are searching furiously for any trace of the enemies who escaped. I'll inform you immediately if I learn anything relevant.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: What happened to Jeralt... It's terrible. If there's anything I can do, simply ask. Even if what you desire is revenge...I'll gladly lend you my power. We can't let them get away with this.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Professor! Welcome back... I was... We all were...  You've been on our minds. Know that your enemies are my enemies. I will do all I can to help you find justice. There is no one else I can... My strength is yours alone. I will fight as you command... I will kill anyone should you ask it of me.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: I'm so sorry about what happened to Jeralt... No...of course my sorrow is nothing compared to yours. The knights are even now searching for our enemies' whereabouts. They are to report back the moment they find something. If you desire revenge, Professor...you can count me in.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Hi, Teach. I see the storm in your eyes has passed… You're looking much better. I've been reading Jeralt's diary. The baby he mentions… That's you, isn't it? I can't understand about half of what's written on here… But Jeralt really cherished you. That much is clear.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: I haven't lost a parent yet, so I can't even begin to understand how you must be feeling... But even while you're standing still, the world keeps on moving. I always find that oddly comforting.

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: I've never been much for condolences. How about a little logic, instead? The knights have spread out around Garreg Mach in search of Jeralt's murderers. Thus, the monastery's fighting strength is, for the moment at least, depleted. Perhaps that was the enemy's real objective. We should be prepared for further confrontation.

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: I've never been much for condolences.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Professor, please lend us your ears. Ferdinand is saying impossible things.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: I do not see what is impossible about it. All I said was that if you want to go back to Brigid, you probably can. You are...the Empire's guest, so to speak. They cannot afford for something bad to happen to you. There would be a diplomatic incident. Someone close to us has turned up dead, so one could argue that you're not safe here anymore.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: You were already told! I am learning here, from the academy. What are you thinking, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You do not have to leave if you do not wish it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You may return home if you please.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I am not returning to home until I have grabbed my goal! I will not be listening to the words of Ferdinand.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: No, look, I did not mean to pressure you. Apologies for the misunderstanding.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I slipped quietly into the vault and rummaged about, looking for anything we might find useful. There is a group of people who want to kill us, after all. What? This is no time for asking permission. I learned long ago that one can ask permission or forgiveness. It is rarely useful to request the former. Still, it appears that the knights have already taken everything useful. There were Crest-related objects I thought might be worth studying, so– There you go again with that stern look. Of course I'll put them back when I'm done. Assuming they bear no additional use.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: I'm not even close to being strong enough. I mean, Jeralt was so much stronger than me, but even he... That's enough. I can't dwell on the past. There's no way to know what my future holds but I do know one thing. Whatever happens, I have to make my own way in this world. I have to keep pushing so I can grow even stronger!

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Professor? I, um, I brought some flowers for Jeralt.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: It's the least I can do. Sometimes I feel like all I do is run away...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're out of your room...

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Hey! Sometimes I go out for, uh...walks...

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Anyway, I'll go lay them out.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: I've sung lyrics lamenting death many times on stage... But when something like this happens in real life... I'm lost. I don't know what to say. But I do know this much... Sir Jeralt must have been very proud to have you as his child.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: It is a shame what happened to Jeralt. I am sorry. There are no words. Leave some flowers on his grave for me.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Dark expressions don't suit you, Professor. But I'm... Well, I'm glad to see you out in the world again. It seems this month will be a quiet one around here. There aren't many knights around to liven things up.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Most of the knights are gone, seeking out the enemy.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Isn't that a bit much? I agree it's important, but is it a good idea to neglect the safety of the monastery?

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: What do you think, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It would be a shame if we were invaded.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: I agree. We can send some knights after our enemies, but so many? It makes the church seem reckless.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're worrying too much.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Hopefully the knights finish their business and hurry back. I wouldn't mind having a few extra lances around.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Not just Tomas, but Monica too. We can't be sure who to trust anymore, can we? Who are these people, really? What do they want?

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I'm so glad you're OK, Professor. I was so worried!

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Oh, Professor! You must be starving. Mercie and I made some sweets for you. We were thinking that if you were to eat something sweet, it might help you feel better.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Thank you for the thought.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Baking sweets is my specialty. I'm sure they'll do the trick.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm fine.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Well, of course you are! And if you have sweets you'll be even more fine.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: I'm so sorry... I never quite know what to say at times like these... Just...don't push yourself too hard too soon. It's OK to allow yourself to be sad right now. Losing someone dear to you... Well, each loss is unique, but it's a feeling I know very well. That said... Professor, I...

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: There is no one here who has not heard tales of Jeralt's valor. We have suffered a most dear loss. I do not know what the enemy's aim was, but I do know this–after what they have done, we cannot suffer them to live. If there is anything I can do to ensure that justice is brought swiftly, you need only give the word.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: You've gotta keep yourself active during tough times, Professor. Even if it seems impossible. That's how I got through when I lost my parents. If you need help with anything, just come and see me. Eating and training are my specialties.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I'm scared. I feel that I don't understand the world. How could something like that happen to Jeralt? He was so strong.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Even though you're scared, push through.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: You're inspiring, Professor. Ill do my best.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What happens, happens.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I suppose, but... Please, take care, Professor! We can't afford to lose you too.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I'm sure you will pull through this because you're so strong, Professor. Best to stay calm during such tumultuous and upsetting times. We don't know the nature of our enemies. If we underestimate them, anything could happen.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: But if we don't defeat them…

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I agree they must be defeated, but I also feel we must approach this with prudence.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We should be careful.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Yes, I agree. I…don't want to lose you too, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Professor! People are saying horrible things about Marianne. They're saying she's friends with the bad guys. If I hear someone say that, I'll…

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Leave it alone, Hilda. It doesn't matter.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Just ignore it.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Of course. Thank you, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll defeat the bad guys. We'll show them.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: That would be the quickest way to resolve this. Come on Marianne, let's give it our all.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I'll say a prayer for Jeralt's soul. There's not much else I can do…

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Professor, it seems like you're holding up OK, but… I'm worried about Leonie. She really loved Jeralt. I hope she can bounce back…

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Captain Jeralt's gone. He's gone. And we'd only just reunited... I'm sorry. I'm sorry, I'm sure this is even harder on you. But I just can't– I can't believe...

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Professor... How are you holding up? I know how heavily grief weighs upon one's heart... I lost my mother some time ago. It was... Forgive me my moment of weakness. Even all these years later, I cannot recall that time without feeling the pain as if it were brand new. Just know that I am praying for your mind and your heart to find peace.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: First Tomas, and now Monica. I do have a theory, though I admit it is nothing more than speculation. Both Tomas and Monica have each gone missing at one time or another. It was reported that when Monica returned from her disappearance, she began to act like a completely different person. As if, perhaps, the real Monica had been killed and replaced by an impostor. Thinking of it like that, it is possible that this Solon had been impersonating Tomas for some time. How they managed such a convincing change of appearance, though, I still do not understand.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: You have lost your father... Now more than ever do I understand how very lucky I am that you were able to save me. Professor, I deeply appreciate what you have done. Thank you. If there is anything at all I can do in return, please tell me, OK?

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: You've lost someone very dear to you... I'm so... You have my sympathy. Manuela and I can take on some of your workload this month. We can't do all the teaching, but at least we can lighten the load for you. I've always seen strength in your eyes. I know you'll recover. You're a very strong person.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: I have something rather uncomfortable to discuss. It's about the weapon that killed Jeralt. Will you listen?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'll listen.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: It was a dagger, but I know enough to know it wasn't an ordinary dagger. It wasn't made of iron or steel because... Well, because whatever it was, the wound it left wasn't normal. Who could make a blade like that, do you figure?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I won't listen.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: I see... That's probably for the best.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: I wonder who they were...

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Oh Goddess, hear my prayer. Please receive this beloved person. When the cold rain washes the body, when the bird and wolf announce the dawn... Receive them into your blue blood. Receive them into a twinkling star. That's a mourning scripture from the Church of Seiros. Lady Rhea taught it to me. I pray that Jeralt is happy in the next world.

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: I heard Jeralt passed away... My deepest condolences. I knew him long before I ever even met you... He was always so much fun to be around... It's such a loss...

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Professor... Thank you for all you have done for us. Nothing to report today. *sobs*

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: We are now within the Sealed Forest. We must not let our guard down.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Professor... We'll avenge Jeralt for you, no matter what!

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Remember--it is a bad idea to get distracted by revenge.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: I have readiness. Our enemies will be taking...we will take our enemies down!

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Well, it's not like we have any other missions this month. I suppose this is as good a way as any to spend our energy.

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: Linhardt spending energy? We had better finish this fast before the pigs start flying everywhere.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Lower your voice. The enemy could be close!

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: It is time to repay the kindness of the professor who saved my life!

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Professor, I know I'm the one who insisted we come here, but don't doubt for a moment that the enemy is waiting for you.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: Lady Edelgard! What are you saying?

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: What other objective could they possibly have? We have no clue what kind of trap is waiting for us. Please be careful, my teacher. We can't afford to lose you...

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: The enemy is strong, but you will prevail. You must.

intro.speaker: Dedue
intro.line: The Sealed Forest is up ahead. Stay alert.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: This is for Captain Jeralt. I will not falter.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: It is time to repay the kindness of the professor who saved my life!

intro.speaker: Ashe
intro.line: Leave it to us, Professor. I'll give it my all.

intro.speaker: Sylvain
intro.line: Fighting Tomas... It will be difficult, that's for certain.

intro.speaker: Mercedes
intro.line: I don't really love the idea of fighting people I know...

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: We don't have a choice. Even if it's difficult, an enemy is an enemy. We've just got to get it over with!

intro.speaker: Felix
intro.line: Just kill them from behind. As long as you don't see their faces, you won't know if you know them.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: We won't know unless we see their face... Yes, I suppose that is true. Professor... I hope you know I meant what I told you before. Your enemy is my enemy. And I will follow you until the end, whatever that end may be.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: That's reassuring.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's do our best.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Yes...right. We'll fulfill our duty together. We've come this far. We can't stop now. I hope you know that you can rely on us. No matter who the enemy is, we are prepared to cut them down.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Yes... No matter who they may be...

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: The Sealed Forest is up ahead. Visibility is awful there, so everyone needs to be extra cautious.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: You seem to know a lot about it. It is just a forest, isn't it?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Have you been there too? Oh… Never mind. Listen, just like I told the archbishop, this is not a war of vengeance. It's a riddle, so to speak. Those guys are undoubtedly planning something terrible. We need some kind of clue as to what. The attack on the Holy Mausoleum. That foul business in Remire. The Demonic Beasts at the chapel… It can't go on. We need to figure out their objective and stop them from achieving it. That's our mission.

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: So, we have our mission now. We had better not fail.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: It is a difficult task, but we will succeed.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: It is time to repay the kindness of the professor who saved my life!

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: An enemy whose objective you don't understand is a frightening prospect.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: We're gonna destroy 'em! It's our mission!

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: I will have my revenge, whatever it takes. On that, I will never budge.

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Leonie… You will have what you seek.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I'll admit, vengeance sounds pretty nice. But don't forget that we're here for information. Luckily, we can easily find what we're looking for while getting revenge for Jeralt. Right, Teach?

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Professor... It is you, right? I knew that you would always come back to us. I'd like to ask about your appearance, but for now, let's dispose of our enemies.

battle.speaker: Solon
battle.line: What did you see in the darkness of Zahras? This should be impossible. The only being that can withstand that darkness is... Unless I dispose of you myself, I may never have the chance to send you back there!

battle.speaker: Solon
battle.line: But this is not the end... Thales will carry out our mission, somehow...

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: It's over. Now, Professor. About your appearance...

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: Professor... That is you, isn't it? I am glad you are safe. I was sure that you would return. Please tell me all that happened to you later. For now, it's imperative that we kill the demon!

battle.speaker: Solon
battle.line: What did you see in the darkness of Zahras? This should be impossible. The only being that can withstand that darkness is... Unless I dispose of you myself, I may never have the chance to send you back there!

battle.speaker: Solon
battle.line: But this is not the end... Thales will carry out our mission, somehow...

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: Thales... Does he also serve the Flame Emperor? It can't be...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Teach... You are Teach, right? I always believed in you... I knew you could cut your way out of anything.

battle.speaker: Solon
battle.line: What did you see in the darkness of Zahras? This should be impossible. The only being that can withstand that darkness is... Unless I dispose of you myself, I may never have the chance to send you back there!

battle.speaker: Solon
battle.line: But this is not the end... Thales will carry out our mission, somehow...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: I guess this is still far from over...

boss.speaker: Solon
boss.line: I have no time to waste on the likes of you...

boss.speaker: Solon
boss.line: To think...that I would lose to mere beasts.

boss.speaker: Solon
boss.line: I am terrified by you... Even though an emotion like fear has no place inside me. That means you must be eliminated.

boss.speaker: Solon
boss.line: So this is how it is... I cannot let you live!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: You stole the words from my mouth. You lost the moment you failed to kill the professor.

cutscene.speaker: Sothis
cutscene.line: Your will and mine are now as one. Both sides of time are revealed to you, and you alone.

cutscene.speaker: Sothis
cutscene.line: You know I am the beginning. What shall you do?

cutscene.speaker: Solon
cutscene.line: So the Fell Star consumes even the darkness itself...

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: That hair...and those eyes... You remind me of someone. What happened to you?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The goddess gifted me her power.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: The goddess? I see... Well, I'm happy for you. Your weapon is called the Sword of the Creator, after all. It's no wonder she looks favorably upon you. Just as it was with saint Seiros, no doubt... And just how will you use this new power, Professor?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: For the people of the world.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Heh, that is so like you to say that.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: For my students.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: For us? I see...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: For myself.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: That is no answer. You must use your power for something greater than yourself.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Tell me... If the world, and your students included, were to divide and go to war with each other, what would you do? In that scenario, each side would represent both the world and your students. Who would you--

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Professor? Have you...fallen asleep?! This must be a side effect of your recent...changes. I can't just leave you here...

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: I shouldn't ask Hubert to carry you, so I suppose it falls to me...

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Professor... I'm glad you're OK. And you seem relatively unscathed. I'm...I'm so relieved. What's more, Jeralt's foe is dead. Though we took little satisfaction from it. Professor... I must ask. What happened after we were separated? You look...different.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The goddess gifted me her power.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: The goddess appeared...and gave you her power? It's as though...the legend of old has been made flesh. It's hard to grasp, in all honestly. But having seen you pierce the sky with my own eyes, I find myself unable to doubt it.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: A legend of old?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Yes. The legend of Saint Seiros. It is said that she received a divine revelation from the goddess and was gifted with her power. Long ago, the goddess dispatched Seiros to defeat an evil king who went mad with power. Perhaps the goddess saw the goodness of Seiros within you too, and wished to help you in your quest to defeat evil. Hm. If you're Seiros, granted power by the goddess, then I suppose that makes me... Ah, never mind. I'm getting carried away.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Professor! What's wrong?! Are you...uh... Are you asleep? What is happening these days? Well, it matters not. We must get you help, and fast.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Sorry, Professor, but I have no choice but to carry you back.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Teach! We won! I'll be honest—when I lost sight of you, I broke into a cold sweat. But Jeralt's killer is dead. All's well that ends well.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: That's true.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: True…

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: You're kidding, right? I understood putting it off while we were in battle, but now that it's over, just go ahead and spit it out. That hair. Those eyes. That unfathomable power. What happened out there?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I will tell you…

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: You mean to tell me…that an entity who claims to be the goddess was living inside your mind? And it's been that way since you were a baby? And this goddess entrusted all of her goddess-like power to you and then vanished…

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: It's a difficult story to swallow, Teach. But the way you look now… I guess I've got no choice but to believe it. How could something like that happen? There must be a clue in Jeralt's diary. If you believe the diary, there's a high possibility that Rhea did something to you when you were born. That's likely when all this began. What in the world happened to you as a baby? And what was Rhea after?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Teach! What's the matter?! Did you trip or… Wait. Are you sleeping? This must be an effect of the goddess's power. I wonder if Teach's body can handle the strain…

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Think, Claude. What now? Should I carry him on my back? Easier said than done…

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: In time's flow...see the glow of flames ever burning bright... On the swift river's drift, broken memories alight...

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Professor. You must remain still.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Where am I?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What happened?

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Everything is all right. There is no need to worry. Those who are trying to harm you are far away.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: ... How lovely...it would be for this moment to last forever... I wish I could hold on to this time we have stolen... that you and I could create a world without end... I have heard whispers of what happened to you. Your appearance... You have received power from the goddess. From the moment you took hold of the Sword of the Creator... I prayed that one day the radiant power of Sothis, which bathes Fódlan in its celestial light, might reside within you. But you are so much more than the light. You are my... Close your eyes, dear one. Sleep, just a while longer.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: I will be watching over you, always. Always and forever...
